frameDefinitions: An Agent (or inanimate Cause) affects a Set so that the number of entities that make up the Set changes from an Initial_number to a Final_number.
There exist a number of different possible Situations that may happen in the future.
Criteria exist that identify a particular Subset of a Group of things into members and non-members.
An Agent changes Tools, from the Old_tool to a New_tool.
An Agent has a choice of whether or not to participate in some Desirable_event because of an Opportunity, a situation not completely under the Agent's control and usually of a limited duration.
This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
frameExamples: More and more resources have been devoted to halting rogue nation's <t>proliferation</t> of controlled nuclear technology.
You have but two <t><fex name='Situation'>choices</fex></t> for your daughter .
Urban areas have> a higher teen suicide <t><fex name='Ratio'>rate</fex></t> than rural areas.
If this happens one more time, we 're going to <t>switch</t> operating systems.
It would be pleasant in the <t>opportune</t> absence of the clergyman to have a dance . DNI
It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who causes the <fen>Set</fen> to increase in number.
The scale along which the <fen>Set</fen> ranges in, i.e., number.
The entity whose amount is being changed.
The force that causes the change.
When the proliferating occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the number of the <fen>Set</fen>.
Something that may happen in the future, or at least whose factual status is unresolved. This is often tagged in a second role layer and generally contains the target.

An individual involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.

'<fex name='Agent'>You</fex> have a <t>choice</t>.'
An entity intimately involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.
A representation of the conditions upon which membership to a <fen>Subset</fen> of a <fen>Group</fen> is determined.
The members of a <fen>Group</fen> that fulfill particular <fen>Criteria</fen> to belong to a <fen>Subset</fen> of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The numerical representation of the size of the <fen>Subset</fen> relative to the size of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The individual that changes their situation.
The entities controlled by an Agent to achieve some Purpose.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> had been using.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> ends up using.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a change.
The situation during which the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen> is possible. For nominal LUs, this is generally in the second layer and contains the target.
The sentient agent that may or may not participate in the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen>.
A situation or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> can participating in during the period of the <fen>Opportunity</fen>.
The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: You have one choice to make <fex>for him</fex>.
This drug can reduce the rate <fex>of heart diseas</fex>e significantly in people over 50.
California has a high <fex>divorce</fex> rate compared to other states.
New laws have raised crime rates <fex>by 5%</fex>
<fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: An Analytic Assessment of U.S. Drug Policy

the United States Conference of Mayors
An Analytic Assessment of U.S. Drug Policy
